title: Version Control
content: Chapter 1 Outline Version control for code and data.

title: Containers
content: Chapter 2 Outline Topics include containers, docker and kubernetes.

title: Pipelines
content: Chapter 3 Outline Topics include ML pipelines in scikit learn and tensorflow.

title: MLOps: Operationalizing Machine Learning
content:
Operationalizing Machine Learning (IDS594) This practice-oriented course surveys modern best practices around getting machine learning (ML) models into production. It continues where IDS 572 and IDS 575 left off: operationalizing machine learning workflows in the context of the larger business end-goals. The course is complementary to IDS 561. We will focus on: (a) ML monitoring, (b) orchestration, © governance, (d) continuous integration/deployment and (e) business impact. A preliminary list of topics that will be covered are:
 Containers for machine learning, the docker ecosystem, Kubernetes Git, CI/CD and their modifications for ML workflows A/B Testing of KPI improvements in Production Experiment tracking and logging Case studies of solutions such as Uberâ€™s Michelangelo, Facebook’s FBLearner Flow, Google’s TFX/Kubeflow and Databricks’ MLFlow.  Prior programming experience: Python
Additional list of topics is being worked on.
 Course logistics are TBD.
 Work in progress. Class starts in Fall 2020.
